business.headline: How Niu Gensheng, China's dairy tycoon, rose from poverty to prosperityNiu Gensheng was born into a poor family in Inner Mongolia. His parents couldn't afford to raise him, so they sold him to a cattle farmer. The farmer adopted him, but life was still full of challenges.

Retail inflation eases further to 3.34% in March, lowest since August 2019The March CPI inflation print came in below February's 3.61%, marking the second straight month that inflation has stayed under the Reserve Bank of India's 4% medium-term target.

Hermes overtakes LVMH in market value years after takeover dramaWay back in 2010, LVMH's billionaire CEO Bernard Arnault shocked the corporate world by acquiring a huge stake in Hermes. It was seen as an effort to seize control of the company. But the Hermes family fought back. They came together to defend their brand and ultimately made Arnault sell his shares.

Sensex gains nearly 1,600 points, Nifty above 23,300; IndusInd bank gains 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 1,577.63 points to close at 76,734.89, while the NSE Nifty50 added 500 points to end at 23,328.55.

Dalal Street dusts off Trump's April 2 tariff shock, stages full comebackTrading resumed after a long weekend, but there was no slowdown in terms of momentum. The Nifty50 climbed as much as 2.4% intraday, comfortably reclaiming its pre-tariff territory, while the Sensex gained over 1,600 points.

UPS vs NPS: Which pension scheme should you opt forThe Unified Pension Scheme is the new retirement scheme effective from April 1, 2025. It is for central government employees. If you're currently under NPS, you'll have the option to shift to this new plan.

This multibagger stock has given 13,000% return. Should you buy?Since its stock market debut on July 28, 2003, the company has delivered a return of nearly 12,951.78%. It touched its 52-week high of Rs 2,559.95 on September 4, 2024.

Adani Green share price jumps 5% today after Q4 business update. Check detailsThe stock rose as much as 5.33% in early trade to hit Rs 941.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 1:05 pm, the shares of the company were trading 4.17% higher at Rs 931.

USD vs INR: CA explains which one actually holds more valueCA Nitin Kaushik said that some people argue that salaries in India grow faster. Though he doesn't deny it, he questions whether that trend still holds true today.

Sensex, Nifty jump 6% in two sessions. Are Dalal Street bulls back on track?While the sharp rebound in equity markets has reignited investor enthusiasm, experts are urging caution amid ongoing global uncertainties, especially around the US trade policy.

'Rich Dad Poor Dad' author warns of giant market crash, bets on gold and BitcoinAccording to Robert Kiyosaki the rising gold, silver, and Bitcoin prices show that traditional ways of saving—like stocks, bonds, mutual funds, and ETFs—are no longer safe.

Should you buy HAL, BEL, Mazagon Dock, other defence stocks? Check price targetDefence companies are expected to do well for many positive reasons. These include higher government spending on defence, tensions between countries, a longer list of defence products being made in India, etc.

Explained: Why HDFC share price surged 4% today and what next?HDFC Bank's share price rose as the country's largest private lender, along with several other banks, cut its deposit interest rate by 25 basis points.

IndusInd Bank, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, SBI: Why banking stocks are rising todayShares of IndusInd Bank gained above 6% on the National Stock Exchange (NSE), while HDFC Bank was up 3.3%. Axis Bank shares rose nearly 3% and ICICI Bank was up 2.3%.
Markets in green amid Trump's tariff rowStock market benchmark indices surged on Tuesday as trading resumed following a long weekend, with auto sector stocks leading the gains.

Is Quess Corp share price down over 50%? Not quite, here's what happenedWhat investors are seeing now is the adjusted market value of Quess Corp after the spin-off. The value of the new entities will be discovered once they are listed on the stock exchanges in the coming weeks.

Tata Motors, M&M, Maruti: Why are auto stocks gaining today?Tata Motors led the pack with a gain of over 5%, while Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) climbed nearly 4%. Maruti Suzuki advanced close to 2%, and other prominent names such as Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto, and Ashok Leyland rose over 1.5%.

Sensex, Nifty rally 2% in early trade. 5 things investors need to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tata Motors led the gains on the Sensex, jumping 5.03% in early trade. Other auto stocks such as Mahindra & Mahindra also performed well, rising 3.74%.
Sensex soars 1,600 points as Trump hints at auto tariff pauseThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,580.01 points to 76,737.27, while the NSE Nifty50 467.30 points to 23,295.85 as of 9:22 am.

Sensex, Nifty opening: Will stock market gain amid positive global cues?Stock market today: Trading on Dalal Street remained shut on Monday due to Ambedkar Jayanti. As trading resumes, investors are hopeful that the markets will continue their positive trend from Friday, when both Sensex and Nifty gained nearly 2%.

Stocks to watch on April 15: Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDAKey stocks to watch on April 15 are shares of Swiggy, HCLTech, Dr Reddy, Tata Power, IREDA ICICI Lombard, ICICI Pru Life, among others, due to varied news developments and Q4 results.

Dr Reddy's asks several top-paid executives to quit in cost-cutting drive: ReportDr Reddy's Laboratories (DRL) FY24 annual report shows it had over 26,000 employees worldwide as of March 2024. That includes 21,757 permanent staff. In FY24, the company hired 6,281 people and spent Rs 5,030 crore on employee benefits,

Over 40? You might be first in line for layoff, says Bombay Shaving Company CEOShantanu Deshpande, founder and CEO of Bombay Shaving Company, said that professionals in their 40s are now the number one targets for layoffs.

Tycoons in turmoil: Indian billionaires caught in Trump's tariff stormThe net worth of Mukesh Ambani, Gautam Adani, Shiv Nadar, and others has taken a massive hit amid a sharp correction in equity markets, fuelled by foreign investor exits and escalating global trade friction. All thanks to US President Donald Trump's tariff shock.

Rs 2.25 crore lumpsum or Rs 84k monthly? Which pension plan should you opt forUnder UPS, the government puts in 10% of your basic salary and dearness allowance and adds another 8.5% to your pension pot. On the other hand, under NPS, the government contributes 14% of your salary.

BluSmart likely to end cab service, join hands with Uber: ReportThe company, which started out by operating electric vehicles on Uber's platform nearly six years ago, is now preparing to shut down its own cab service and supply cars to Uber again.

Investing or borrowing? Check new SBI, HDFC, BOI interest ratesThe latest rate cut signals a broader trend—savers are using savings accounts mainly for transactions, while putting the rest in fixed deposits for better returns.

Mehul Choksi arrested in Belgium: What is the Rs 14,000-crore PNB scam?Mehul Choksi once headed the Gitanjali Group, a well-known jewellery firm. Born in 1959, Choksi was active in the diamond industry for many years.

Bank of India cuts home loan rates for new, existing customers. Check detailsThis adjustment is expected to make borrowing slightly easier for individuals at a time when the RBI is clearly looking to revive private investment and sustain domestic demand.

What to expect from stock market this week? 4 key things investors should knowMultiple factors could determine the mood on Dalal Street. From April 12 to 19, investors will be watching crucial Q4 earnings, economic data releases in India, the US, and China.
Investor visits Mumbai slum, uncovers truth about 'Make in India'Veteran investor Shankar Sharma recently shared a personal experience that raised fresh questions about India's manufacturing reality.

'Shift to UAE': Kotak AMC MD Nilesh Shah flags tax loophole exploited by NRIsNilesh Shah has warned that high-net-worth individuals could exploit tax treaties with some countries to avoid India's capital gains tax.

RBI may pay record Rs 2.5 lakh crore dividend to centre in FY25The RBI is likely to announce the exact dividend amount in late May. Last year, the payout surprised many as it was double what most had expected.

Ambedkar Jayanti 2025: Is the stock market closed today?Over the past few months, benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty have seen large ups and downs, with global news, especially from the United States, playing a major role in the market's movement.

Tariff war may benefit India despite short-term shocks: Mercedes-Benz India CEOMercedes-Benz India CEO Santosh Iyer stated that India may benefit from the ongoing global tariff war in the long term despite short-term challenges. He highlights the potential for increased trade and reduced barriers as a positive outcome for India.

Why is Apple in a race against time to fly iPhones back to the US?Apple's long-term goal is to reduce its dependence on Chinese factories and shift more production to other countries, with India playing a big part in that plan.  However, it relies heavily on a network of suppliers and trained workers that only exists at the required scale in parts of Asia.

RBI launches WhatsApp Channel: Here's how to access it via QR codeThe RBI said that the goal of the WhatsApp channel is to provide verified and timely information about banking, digital safety, and other important topics directly to users.

Pentagon cuts $5.1 billion contracts with Accenture, Deloitte: Wasteful spendingThe contracts appeared to be wide-ranging cuts to consulting services for the Navy, the Air Force, the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) and the Defense Health Agency.

Wall Street bounces back after wild week fueled by tariff warAll three major US indexes ended the session sharply higher after assurances from Boston Federal Reserve President Susan Collins that the Fed is prepared to keep financial markets functioning should the need arise.

India pushing for trade deals with US, EU with high urgency: JaishankarOn Wednesday, Trump announced a 90-day pause on his sweeping tariffs on all countries, except China as countries around the world wilted under the impact of the seismic action.

entertainment.headline: Sunny Deol's Jaat sparks Christian outrage over church scene, community demands banThe release of Sunny Deol's latest film 'Jaat' has ignited controversy due to a scene perceived as disrespectful by the Christian community. The community has demanded a ban and legal action, claiming the portrayal is an insult to their faith.

AR Rahman reacts to Abhijeet Bhattacharya slamming him for 'overusing' technologySinger Abhijeet Bhattacharya criticised AR Rahman for overusing technology in music, impacting live instrumentation. AR Rahman defended himself in an exclusive interview, highlighting his support for musicians.

The Last of Us Season 2: Who Is Eugene and Why His Death MattersThe Last of Us Season 2 introduces Eugene, a mysterious off-screen character whose death—linked to Joel—adds emotional depth and unanswered questions. Though absent in life, Eugene's story unfolds through flashbacks and dialogue, setting up a powerful turning point in the HBO series.

Ibrahim Ali Khan finally addresses Nadaaniyan criticism: They tried to twist itIbrahim Ali Khan breaks his silence over criticism of his debut film 'Nadaaniyan'. The actor admitted that he needs to work on his craft, but maintained that social media was harsher than it should have been while reviewing the film.

Premalu actor Naslen reveals why he rejected to Ajith Kumar's Good Bad UglyDuring a recent press meet for the film 'Alappuzha Gymkhana', Malayalam actor Naslen Gafoor revealed why he turned down a role in Ajith Kumar's 'Good Bad Ugly'. Naslen is best known for the blockbuster Premalu (2024).

The Last of Us S2's Kaitlyn Dever on security concerns, taking on Abby's roleThe second season of 'The Last of Us' introduces Kaitlyn Dever as Abby Anderson, a character known for dividing fans due to her controversial actions in the video game series. Despite rumours of needing extra security, Dever clarifies she never made such a statement and feels confident in the support from the show's creators.

Palak Tiwari on debut with Salman Khan: Wouldn't have done it any other wayPalak Tiwari reflects on her debut with Salman Khan in 'Kisi Ka Bhai Kisi Ki Jaan', expressing gratitude for the experience despite limited screen time. The actor will next be seen in 'The Bhootniii.'

Backstreet Boy Nick Carter accused of sexual assaults in new lawsuitBackstreet Boys' Nick Carter is embroiled in a fresh lawsuit accusing him of sexual assaults and knowingly transmitting STDs. The accuser, Laura Penly, detailed multiple incidents and and is seeking damages.

Priyanka Chahar talks about 'moving forward' amid breakup rumours with Ankit GuptaActor Priyanka Chahar Choudhary seemingly confirmed her breakup with actor Ankit Gupta. In an interview, she talked about moving forward in life and embracing change.
John Travolta pays tribute to late son Jett on birthday: Love you foreverActor John Travolta shared a moving tribute to his late son Jett on what would have been his birthday. Jett died in 2009.

Like Adolescence, Indian films and shows that mastered one-shot techniqueIt's not just challenging but also demanding for both the audience and the filmmakers to tell a story or a part of their story using a one-shot camera technique. With 'Adolescence' creating noise about the same, here's a list of Indian shows and films that make the best use of this style of camera movement.

Ilaiyaraaja sends legal notice to Good Bad Ugly makers, demands Rs 5 croreLegendary music director Ilaiyaraaja has issued a legal notice to the makers of Ajith Kumar's Good Bad Ugly for using altered versions of three of his iconic songs without permission. He has demanded Rs 5 crore in compensation and the removal of the songs from the recently released action-comedy.

Rapper Lil Nas X suffers partial facial paralysis, shares update from hospital bedRapper Lil Nas X reveals he's lost control of the right side of his face, sharing a video from his hospital bed. Fans express concern as he struggles to smile and speak. Updates on his condition are awaited.
Tamil director-actor SS Stanley dies at 57 in ChennaiPopular Tamil director and actor SS Stanley died at 57 due to health complications. He was undergoing treatment in a private hospital in Chennai.

Nani's dialogue in HIT 3 trailer resonates with fans, draws parallel with real-lifeIn the newly released trailer of HIT 3, Nani's powerful one-liner about survival has struck a chord with fans, who see it as a nod to his journey in the film industry as an outsider.

Sunny Deol recalls visiting Dharmendra on Ankhen sets: There was a tigerSunny Deol shares treasured childhood memories of visiting his father, Dharmendra, on film sets, highlighting the impact these experiences had on him.  He reflects on memorable moments, including witnessing daring scenes and enjoying simple joys during shoots.

Won't stand behind Aamir: Randeep Hooda regrets leaving Rang De Basanti out of egoActor Randeep Hooda shared the story of rejecting 'Rang De Basanti'. He said in a podcast that he blames his 'jaat arrogance' for making that unfortunate choice.

Vivek Dahiya reacts to divorce rumours with Divyanka Tripathi: We are enjoying itVivek Dahiya humorously dismissed divorce rumours with Divyanka Tripathi, sharing that they are simply enjoying the speculation.

Katy Perry says 'no place like home' in first post after space tripKaty Perry shared her first post following her brief trip to space on April 14. The pop star journeyed aboard Blue Origin's New Shephard on an all-female-crewed 11-minute mission on Monday.

general news.headline: ED's big move against Sonia Gandhi, Rahul in National Herald money laundering caseThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday filed a chargesheet against Congress MPs Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi, and Indian Overseas Congress chief Sam Pitroda in the alleged National Herald money laundering case.

In Muda case against Siddaramaiah, court wants full report, orders further probeA Bengaluru special court postponed its decision on the Lokayukta's closure report in the Muda case involving Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, ordering Lokayukta police to continue further investigation into the allegations against others.

South states take 5 top spots, Bengal last in policing, justice delivery: ReportThe India Justice Report of 2025 has revealed that the southern states have excelled in policing, justice delivery and prison management. While Karnataka led the pack, West Bengal slipped to the bottom. Telangana made the biggest leap, vaulting from 11th to 3rd place among the large and mid-sized states.

MIT says 9 student visas revoked without explanation: 'Extremely concerning'Till now, the US government has cancelled the visas of nearly 530 students, faculty and researchers. MIT President, Sally Kornbluth, said the university remains "extremely concerned" about the broader implications of the abrupt visa revocation.
Maach, mishti, and more: Why fish is not just food for Bengalis, it is sacredFish market by a Kali temple, sacred or sacrilege?

Bangladeshi miscreants involved in Bengal Waqf violence, Centre told: SourcesThe probe found that the Mamata Banerjee-led government failed to monitor the intruders as unrest gripped two districts in Bengal over the Waqf law, killing three people.

'Increase your security': Ayodhya Ram Mandir gets threat mail, case filedThe Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra Trust, which manages the Ram Temple in Ayodhya, received a bomb threat mail on Monday. The mail originated from Tamil Nadu and the cyber cell was probing the matter.

India may receive above-normal monsoon rains in 2025, weather department predictsThe officials said all key climate factors — including the El Nino and the Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD) — are currently in a neutral phase. These neutral conditions are considered favourable for a healthy monsoon.
Aliens turned 23 Soviet soldiers into stones? Chilling details in CIA fileA declassified CIA file claims a clash between Soviet soldiers and aliens turned 23 troops to stone.

Days after big win over Governor, Tamil Nadu's move to secure more autonomyThe committee, which will be headed by former Supreme Court judge Kurian Joseph, will submit its interim report by January 2026 and the final report within two years.

Once a Waqf, always a Waqf: Congress MLA backs claim on Tamil Nadu village landFresh controversy was triggered after a Dargah sent eviction notices to residents of a village in Vellore, Tamil Nadu, claiming it was part of Waqf board.

China stops US-made Boeing jet deliveries as trade war expands: ReportBeijing has ordered the immediate stoppage of any purchases related to aircraft machinery and equipment from US companies, escalating the trade war between the two nations.

Felt like toilet paper: Singapore woman shares employee's brutal resignation noteIn a now-viral LinkedIn post, a Singapore-based businesswoman shared how an employee resigned, saying they felt like "toilet paper" at their company.

How Niu Gensheng, China's dairy tycoon, rose from poverty to prosperityNiu Gensheng was born into a poor family in Inner Mongolia. His parents couldn't afford to raise him, so they sold him to a cattle farmer. The farmer adopted him, but life was still full of challenges.

India seeing 'very good progress' on trade talks with US: ReportCommerce Secretary Sunil Barthwal expressed hope that India would be able to negotiate a good bilateral trade agreement with the US. He said the trade talks had seen "very good progress".

Sensex gains nearly 1,600 points, Nifty above 23,300; IndusInd bank gains 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 1,577.63 points to close at 76,734.89, while the NSE Nifty50 added 500 points to end at 23,328.55.

Trump aide's dress made in China? Chinese envoy's claim sparks debateA Chinese envoy has claimed that White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt made a public appearance in a dress that was apparently made in China.

Why no Mamata for victims, but mollycoddling of aggressorsEven as Hindus were hacked to death and hundreds of families fled communal riots in West Bengal after anti-waqf protests turned violent, CM Mamata Banerjee chose appeasement over action. While Mamata and Trinamool leaders have spoken, appealed to and mollycoddled the rioters, they haven't condoled the deaths and devastation.

Supreme Court questions High Court's 'she invited trouble' remark in rape caseThe Supreme Court blasted the Allahabad High Court after it granted bail to a person accused of raping a student and said the woman 'herself invited trouble'.

Union Minister says new Waqf Act will not let Munambam-like issue to happenAmid outrage in Kerala's Munambam over land ownership, Union Minister Kiren Rijiju says recent Waqf Act changes aim to curb unchecked claims, restore rights, and end misuse of sweeping board powers.
Tata targets real-world range of around 500km for Harrier.evTata Harrier.ev will be launched in India in FY26. It will be the homegrown auto major's flagship electric SUV.

Bat sizes under scanner: Why BCCI introduced in-match checks in IPL 2025IPL 2025: In a first in the ongoing season of the Indian Premier League, on-field umpires have been directed to check the size of bats used by players during the game. Here's why the BCCI amped up its vigilance on the size of the blades.

Stay for 3 days, you'll get infected: Nitin Gadkari warns on Delhi air pollutionCiting a medical research, Nitin Gadkari warned that Delhi's pollution can cause infections within days and reduce life expectancy by 10 years.

'Factually incorrect' JEE Main 2025 questions spark outrage, mails unansweredA fresh controversy has hit the NTA. The JEE Main 2025 has stirred an uproar as students and parents flagged major errors in response sheets and answer keys.

sports.headline: India announce Sudirman Cup squad, Gayatri Gopichand and Jolly Treesa miss outSudirman Cup 2025: Gayatri Gopichand and Jolly Treesa will miss the prestigious mixed team event due to injuries. However, India are bolstered by the return of former World No. 1 men's doubles pairing of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty.

Mohsin Naqvi fails to attend quarterly meeting of ICC post Champions TrophyPakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chairman Mohsin Naqvi failed to attend the quarterly meeting of the ICC (International Cricket Council) in Harare due to pending personal business in Pakistan.

MS Dhoni's run-out vs LSG fluke? CSK captain reflects on magical effortIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: MS Dhoni reflected on his magical effort with the gloves, saying he wasn't sure whether his throw would hit the stumps at the non-striker's end. Dhoni's run-out of Abdul Samad in Lucknow left quite a few in awe.

Rohit's struggles has not let MI set the tone in IPL 2025: Anjum ChopraFormer India captain Anjum Chopra believes that Rohit Sharma's poor form has not allowed Mumbai Indians to set the tone in the Indian Premier League so far, Anjum feels that MI might need to demote Rohit to the middle-order.

Injury scare for MS Dhoni? CSK captain seen limping after heroics vs LSG in LucknowIPL 2025, LSG vs CSK: After hitting a match-winning 26 off just 11 balls, MS Dhoni was seen limping as he went up to collect the Player of the Match award. Dhoni has been managing a troublesome knee over the past few years.

Bat sizes under scanner: Why BCCI introduced in-match checks in IPL 2025IPL 2025: In a first in the ongoing season of the Indian Premier League, on-field umpires have been directed to check the size of bats used by players during the game. Here's why the BCCI amped up its vigilance on the size of the blades.

India to tour Bangladesh in 2025 for 3 ODIs and T20IsThe Indian Cricket Board (BCCI) has announced that the men's team will tour Bangladesh for 3 ODIs and as many T20Is in the month of August. This will serve as the teams' preparation for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Bench Maxwell? Who replaces Lockie? Crucial calls await Punjab in KKR clashShreyas Iyer will face his former side on Tuesday, April 15, as Punjab Kings take on Kolkata Knight Riders in Mullanpur, Chandigarh. PBKS are coming off a hammering vs SRH in the last. Will they be able to reset and deliver today?

Sunil Gavaskar's foundation offers Rs 30,000 per month aid to Vinod Kambli: ReportSunil Gavaskar met with Vinod Kambli's doctors in January before instructing his foundation to begin providing financial and medical assistance to the former Indian cricketer. Gavaskar had met the ailing Kambli during the 50th anniversary celebrations of the Wankhede Stadium.

Maxwell has had his run: Doull wants PBKS to bench all-rounder vs KKRAustralian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has been in woeful form in the IPL 2025. Punjab Kings might start thinking about replacing him with either Azmatullah Omarzai or Josh Inglis, feels Simon Doull.

Shreyas Iyer's comeback run in Champions Trophy rewarded with ICC awardStar batter Shreyas Iyer was honoured with the ICC Player of the Month award for March 2025. Iyer top-scored for India in the Champions Trophy, playing a key role in their triumphant run in Dubai.

India to tour Bangladesh in 2025 for 3 ODIs and T20IsThe Indian Cricket Board (BCCI) has announced that the men's team will tour Bangladesh for 3 ODIs and as many T20Is in the month of August. This will serve as the teams' preparation for the 2026 T20 World Cup.

Bench Maxwell? Who replaces Lockie? Crucial calls await Punjab in KKR clashShreyas Iyer will face his former side on Tuesday, April 15, as Punjab Kings take on Kolkata Knight Riders in Mullanpur, Chandigarh. PBKS are coming off a hammering vs SRH in the last. Will they be able to reset and deliver today?

Sunil Gavaskar's foundation offers Rs 30,000 per month aid to Vinod Kambli: ReportSunil Gavaskar met with Vinod Kambli's doctors in January before instructing his foundation to begin providing financial and medical assistance to the former Indian cricketer. Gavaskar had met the ailing Kambli during the 50th anniversary celebrations of the Wankhede Stadium.

Maxwell has had his run: Doull wants PBKS to bench all-rounder vs KKRAustralian all-rounder Glenn Maxwell has been in woeful form in the IPL 2025. Punjab Kings might start thinking about replacing him with either Azmatullah Omarzai or Josh Inglis, feels Simon Doull.

Shreyas Iyer's comeback run in Champions Trophy rewarded with ICC awardStar batter Shreyas Iyer was honoured with the ICC Player of the Month award for March 2025. Iyer top-scored for India in the Champions Trophy, playing a key role in their triumphant run in Dubai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
